channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is: Evaluating Strategic Planning and Execution of LLM Agents in an Auction Arena
item.description: Notably, even our most advanced models (GPT-4) are occasionally surpassed by heuristic baselines and human agents, highlighting the potential for further improvements in the design of LLM agents and the important role that our simulation environment can play in further testing and refining agent architectures.

item.title: Sentence-level Prompts Benefit Composed Image Retrieval
item.description: Composed image retrieval (CIR) is the task of retrieving specific images by using a query that involves both a reference image and a relative caption.

item.title: Query and Response Augmentation Cannot Help Out-of-domain Math Reasoning Generalization
item.description: In this paper, we conduct an investigation for such data augmentation in math reasoning and are intended to answer: (1) What strategies of data augmentation are more effective; (2) What is the scaling relationship between the amount of augmented data and model performance; and (3) Can data augmentation incentivize generalization to out-of-domain mathematical reasoning tasks?

item.title: GraphLLM: Boosting Graph Reasoning Ability of Large Language Model
item.description: This synergy equips LLMs with the ability to proficiently interpret and reason on graph data, harnessing the superior expressive power of graph learning models.

item.title: Fine-grained Audio-Visual Joint Representations for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Audio-visual large language models (LLM) have drawn significant attention, yet the fine-grained combination of both input streams is rather under-explored, which is challenging but necessary for LLMs to understand general video inputs.

item.title: Humanoid Agents: Platform for Simulating Human-like Generative Agents
item.description: Just as computational simulations of atoms, molecules and cells have shaped the way we study the sciences, true-to-life simulations of human-like agents can be valuable tools for studying human behavior.

item.title: Universal Multi-modal Entity Alignment via Iteratively Fusing Modality Similarity Paths
item.description: The objective of Entity Alignment (EA) is to identify equivalent entity pairs from multiple Knowledge Graphs (KGs) and create a more comprehensive and unified KG.

item.title: Generative Judge for Evaluating Alignment
item.description: The rapid development of Large Language Models (LLMs) has substantially expanded the range of tasks they can address.

item.title: ParFam -- Symbolic Regression Based on Continuous Global Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we present our new method ParFam that utilizes parametric families of suitable symbolic functions to translate the discrete symbolic regression problem into a continuous one, resulting in a more straightforward setup compared to current state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: Deep Optimal Timing Strategies for Time Series
item.description: Deciding the best future execution time is a critical task in many business activities while evolving time series forecasting, and optimal timing strategy provides such a solution, which is driven by observed data.

item.title: DiffCPS: Diffusion Model based Constrained Policy Search for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Constrained policy search (CPS) is a fundamental problem in offline reinforcement learning, which is generally solved by advantage weighted regression (AWR).

item.title: Aligning Language Models with Human Preferences via a Bayesian Approach
item.description: For this alignment, current popular methods leverage a reinforcement learning (RL) approach with a reward model trained on feedback from humans.

item.title: A Closer Look into Automatic Evaluation Using Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we analyze LLM evaluation (Chiang and Lee, 2023) and G-Eval (Liu et al., 2023), and we discuss how those details in the evaluation process change how well the ratings given by LLMs correlate with human ratings.

item.title: Fast and Robust Early-Exiting Framework for Autoregressive Language Models with Synchronized Parallel Decoding
item.description: To tackle the high inference latency exhibited by autoregressive language models, previous studies have proposed an early-exiting framework that allocates adaptive computation paths for each token based on the complexity of generating the subsequent token.

item.title: Uni3DETR: Unified 3D Detection Transformer
item.description: In this paper, we propose Uni3DETR, a unified 3D detector that addresses indoor and outdoor 3D detection within the same framework.

item.title: A Simple and Robust Framework for Cross-Modality Medical Image Segmentation applied to Vision Transformers
item.description: In this work, we propose a simple framework to achieve fair image segmentation of multiple modalities using a single conditional model that adapts its normalization layers based on the input type, trained with non-registered interleaved mixed data.

item.title: Problem-Solving Guide: Predicting the Algorithm Tags and Difficulty for Competitive Programming Problems
item.description: Moreover, we also consider predicting the difficulty levels of algorithm problems, which can be used as useful guidance to calculate the required time to solve that problem.

item.title: Lightweight Full-Convolutional Siamese Tracker
item.description: Moreover, existing lightweight trackers only achieve balance between 2-3 points in terms of parameters, performance, Flops and FPS.

item.title: XAL: EXplainable Active Learning Makes Classifiers Better Low-resource Learners
item.description: During the selection of unlabeled data, we combine the predictive uncertainty of the encoder and the explanation score of the decoder to acquire informative data for annotation.

item.title: SocialCircle: Learning the Angle-based Social Interaction Representation for Pedestrian Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Analyzing and forecasting trajectories of agents like pedestrians and cars in complex scenes has become more and more significant in many intelligent systems and applications.

item.title: Larth: Dataset and Machine Translation for Etruscan
item.description: Etruscan is an ancient language spoken in Italy from the 7th century BC to the 1st century AD.

item.title: Care3D: An Active 3D Object Detection Dataset of Real Robotic-Care Environments
item.description: As labor shortage increases in the health sector, the demand for assistive robotics grows.

item.title: Anchor-Intermediate Detector: Decoupling and Coupling Bounding Boxes for Accurate Object Detection
item.description: The corner-aware head is able to score the corners of each bounding box to facilitate the coupling between corner points.

item.title: mBBC: Exploring the Multilingual Maze
item.description: Using the self-supervised task of next token prediction, we assess their performance across a diverse set of languages, with a focus on understanding the impact of resource availability, word order, language family, and script type on model accuracy.

item.title: Quantum Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Various BO algorithms have been theoretically shown to enjoy upper bounds on their cumulative regret which are sub-linear in the number T of iterations, and a regret lower bound of Omega(sqrt(T)) has been derived which represents the unavoidable regrets for any classical BO algorithm.

item.title: WikiIns: A High-Quality Dataset for Controlled Text Editing by Natural Language Instruction
item.description: In this paper, we study the problem of controlled text editing by natural language instruction.

item.title: Hieros: Hierarchical Imagination on Structured State Space Sequence World Models
item.description: Due to the special properties of S5 layers, our method can train in parallel and predict next world states iteratively during imagination.

item.title: Toolink: Linking Toolkit Creation and Using through Chain-of-Solving on Open-Source Model
item.description: We first validate the efficacy of Toolink in harnessing the model's creativity and CoS ability on ChatGPT.

item.title: Fast-DetectGPT: Efficient Zero-Shot Detection of Machine-Generated Text via Conditional Probability Curvature
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have shown the ability to produce fluent and cogent content, presenting both productivity opportunities and societal risks.

item.title: DeepQTest: Testing Autonomous Driving Systems with Reinforcement Learning and Real-world Weather Data
item.description: In addition, existing ADS testing techniques have limited effectiveness in ensuring the realism of test scenarios, especially the realism of weather conditions and their changes over time.

item.title: ZooPFL: Exploring Black-box Foundation Models for Personalized Federated Learning
item.description: When personalized federated learning (FL) meets large foundation models, new challenges arise from various limitations in resources.

item.title: GSLB: The Graph Structure Learning Benchmark
item.description: To fill this gap, we systematically analyze the performance of GSL in different scenarios and develop a comprehensive Graph Structure Learning Benchmark (GSLB) curated from 20 diverse graph datasets and 16 distinct GSL algorithms.

item.title: From Data to Dialogue: Leveraging the Structure of Knowledge Graphs for Conversational Exploratory Search
item.description: Exploratory search is an open-ended information retrieval process that aims at discovering knowledge about a topic or domain rather than searching for a specific answer or piece of information.

item.title: GEAR: A GPU-Centric Experience Replay System for Large Reinforcement Learning Models
item.description: This paper introduces a distributed, GPU-centric experience replay system, GEAR, designed to perform scalable reinforcement learning (RL) with large sequence models (such as transformers).

item.title: Tailoring Self-Attention for Graph via Rooted Subtrees
item.description: Attention mechanisms have made significant strides in graph learning, yet they still exhibit notable limitations: local attention faces challenges in capturing long-range information due to the inherent problems of the message-passing scheme, while global attention cannot reflect the hierarchical neighborhood structure and fails to capture fine-grained local information.

item.title: FLatS: Principled Out-of-Distribution Detection with Feature-Based Likelihood Ratio Score
item.description: Backed by theoretical analysis, this paper advocates for the measurement of the "OOD-ness" of a test case $\boldsymbol{x}$ through the likelihood ratio between out-distribution $\mathcal P_{\textit{out}}$ and in-distribution $\mathcal P_{\textit{in}}$.

item.title: InstructDET: Diversifying Referring Object Detection with Generalized Instructions
item.description: In order to encompass common detection expressions, we involve emerging vision-language model (VLM) and large language model (LLM) to generate instructions guided by text prompts and object bbxs, as the generalizations of foundation models are effective to produce human-like expressions (e. g., describing object property, category, and relationship).

item.title: UReader: Universal OCR-free Visually-situated Language Understanding with Multimodal Large Language Model
item.description: Text is ubiquitous in our visual world, conveying crucial information, such as in documents, websites, and everyday photographs.

item.title: Distantly-Supervised Joint Entity and Relation Extraction with Noise-Robust Learning
item.description: However, existing research primarily addresses only one type of noise, thereby limiting the effectiveness of noise reduction.

item.title: Persis: A Persian Font Recognition Pipeline Using Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: What happens if we encounter a suitable font for our design work but do not know its name?

item.title: DialCoT Meets PPO: Decomposing and Exploring Reasoning Paths in Smaller Language Models
item.description: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting has proven to be effective in enhancing the reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) with at least 100 billion parameters.

item.title: Building an Open-Vocabulary Video CLIP Model with Better Architectures, Optimization and Data
item.description: Despite significant results achieved by Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) in zero-shot image recognition, limited effort has been made exploring its potential for zero-shot video recognition.

item.title: OV-PARTS: Towards Open-Vocabulary Part Segmentation
item.description: Secondly, part segmentation introduces an open granularity challenge due to the diverse and often ambiguous definitions of parts in the open world.

item.title: A Corrected Expected Improvement Acquisition Function Under Noisy Observations
item.description: Sequential maximization of expected improvement (EI) is one of the most widely used policies in Bayesian optimization because of its simplicity and ability to handle noisy observations.

item.title: Simplifying GNN Performance with Low Rank Kernel Models
item.description: We posit that many of the current GNN architectures may be over-engineered.

item.title: An Investigation of LLMs' Inefficacy in Understanding Converse Relations
item.description: Our ConvRE features two tasks, Re2Text and Text2Re, which are formulated as multi-choice question answering to evaluate LLMs' ability to determine the matching between relations and associated text.

item.title: HOD: A Benchmark Dataset for Harmful Object Detection
item.description: We present a new benchmark dataset for harmful object detection.

item.title: AANet: Aggregation and Alignment Network with Semi-hard Positive Sample Mining for Hierarchical Place Recognition
item.description: Here we propose a Dynamically Aligning Local Features (DALF) algorithm to align the local features under spatial constraints.

item.title: Symmetrical Linguistic Feature Distillation with CLIP for Scene Text Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we explore the potential of the Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) model in scene text recognition (STR), and establish a novel Symmetrical Linguistic Feature Distillation framework (named CLIP-OCR) to leverage both visual and linguistic knowledge in CLIP.

item.title: Uncovering hidden geometry in Transformers via disentangling position and context
item.description: Given embedding vector $\boldsymbol{h}_{c, t} \in \mathbb{R}^d$ at sequence position $t \le T$ in a sequence (or context) $c \le C$, extracting the mean effects yields the decomposition \[ \boldsymbol{h}_{c, t} = \boldsymbol{\mu} + \mathbf{pos}_t + \mathbf{ctx}_c + \mathbf{resid}_{c, t} \] where $\boldsymbol{\mu}$ is the global mean vector, $\mathbf{pos}_t$ and $\mathbf{ctx}_c$ are the mean vectors across contexts and across positions respectively, and $\mathbf{resid}_{c, t}$ is the residual vector.
